dt: {bc}the art or act of identifying a disease from its signs and symptoms
{bc}investigation or analysis of the cause or nature of a condition, situation, or problem
{bc}a statement or conclusion from such an analysis

et: New Latin, from Greek {it}diagnōsis{/it}, from {it}diagignōskein{/it} to distinguish, from {it}dia-{/it} + {it}gignōskein{/it} to know {ma}{mat|know|}{/ma}
shortdef: the art or act of identifying a disease from its signs and symptoms
investigation or analysis of the cause or nature of a condition, situation, or problem

dt: {bc}the distinguishing of a disease or condition from others presenting with similar signs and symptoms

shortdef: the distinguishing of a disease or condition from others presenting with similar signs and symptoms

dt: {bc}any of the payment categories that are used to classify patients and especially Medicare patients for the purpose of reimbursing hospitals for each case in a given category with a fixed fee regardless of the actual costs incurred

shortdef: any of the payment categories that are used to classify patients and especially Medicare patients for the purpose of reimbursing hospitals for each case in a given category with a fixed fee regardless of the actual costs incurred —called also diagnosis related group
